barker_notes.barker_summary: W. Taylor to Austin, Vera Cruz, July 28, 1829. Wants land for settlement in Texas. Asks advice.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*W. Taylor to Austin, Vera Cruz, July 28, 1829. Wants land for settlement in Texas. Asks advice.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Veracrus */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-28-1829">28 July 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p* *p*Various have been our fortunes since we met and parted in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*— You remember that this was then as it still is, my post, at which, I have ever since resided—Save occasionally a tour into the *location_mentioned*interior*/location_mentioned*, or a trip to the *location_mentioned*States */location_mentioned*I have heard of the progress of your *location_mentioned*Settlement */location_mentioned*which I consider to be too firmly rooted, to be easily or readily eradicated— I have not forgotten your invitation to me to settle in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*—- After which I have always had a kind of hankering my present object is to obtain a small grant of from Fifty to one hundred to embrace both sides of some *location_mentioned*water course*/location_mentioned*, with due attention to soil, wood, and water, as I have a number of *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned* whom I could induce to move out, and who would form no inconsiderable acquisitions to your infant State—but I can do nothing— viz will attempt nothing without your aid and advice. What I would have you to do for me in this business is, to select Me *location_mentioned*tracts */location_mentioned*of country— draw the plot with the boundaries etc. and to furnish me with your advice as to the Measures to be taken by me in order to secure the Grant. All which, from your local Knowledge of the *location_mentioned*County*/location_mentioned*, may be done in your *location_mentioned*office*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*please write to me thru *person_mentioned*Messrs Jas. W. Zackerie*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Co N. orls*/person_mentioned* as well as under Care to the *person_mentioned*Honorable J. E. Poinsett Envdo Extrary Min. Píen, de *location_mentioned*Los E. E. U. U. de America*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*—*location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*provided thro' this latter channel I could expect to hear from you in any reasonable time— perhaps it were better to send both original and Dupls Via *location_mentioned*N. orls*/location_mentioned*— my intention is to leave this part of *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*next *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1829">winter*/date_mentioned*, and therefore am the more anxious to hear from you soon*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. Taylor*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Genl Sant Ana*/person_mentioned* who was *person_mentioned*gouvanor of the State of *location_mentioned*VeraCrus*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Military Comand1 of the District*/person_mentioned* is now here with about 2000 *person_mentioned*Troops */person_mentioned*in the expectation of being attacked by an *person_mentioned*expedition */person_mentioned*sd to have recently left the *location_mentioned*Hava */location_mentioned*but that expedn must be detined else where.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*T*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned* Colo Stephen Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Austin Settlement Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
